description: A dashboard that gives an overview of Tailscale API metrics. The dashboards were generated using [tailscale-mixin](https://github.com/adinhodovic/tailscale-exporter/tree/main/tailscale-mixin). Open issues and create feature requests in the repository.

panels.description: The total number of users in the selected tailnet.

targets.expr: sum(tailscale_users_info{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"})

panels.title: Users

panels.description: The total number of devices in the selected tailnet.

targets.expr: sum(tailscale_devices_info{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"})

panels.title: Devices

panels.description: The total number of devices that are currently online in the selected tailnet.

targets.expr: sum(tailscale_devices_online{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"})

panels.title: Devices Logged In

panels.description: The total number of keys in the selected tailnet.

targets.expr: sum(tailscale_keys_info{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"})

panels.title: Keys

panels.description: A table showing the nameservers configured for the selected tailnet.

targets.expr: sum by(nameserver) (tailscale_dns_nameservers_info{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"})

panels.title: Nameservers

panels.description: Whether Magic DNS is enabled for the selected tailnet.

targets.expr: sum(tailscale_dns_magic_dns{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"})

panels.title: Magic DNS Enabled

panels.description: A table showing the current settings for the selected tailnet.

targets.expr: tailscale_tailnet_settings_info{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"}

panels.title: Tailnet Settings

panels.description: A pie chart showing the distribution of devices by operating system in the selected tailnet.
panels.title: Devices by OS

panels.description: A pie chart showing the distribution of devices by Tailscale client version in the selected tailnet.
panels.title: Devices by Version

panels.description: The total number of devices that have an update available in the selected tailnet.
panels.title: Devices with Update Available

panels.description: The total number of devices that are authorized to access the tailnet.
panels.title: Authorized Devices

panels.description: A table showing all devices in the selected tailnet.

targets.expr: tailscale_devices_info{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"}

panels.title: Devices

panels.description: A table showing all devices in the selected tailnet.

targets.expr: min by(name, id) (tailscale_devices_created_timestamp{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"} * 1000)

panels.title: Devices Settings

panels.description: A timeseries panel showing devices that have an update available.

targets.expr: sum by(name, id) (tailscale_devices_update_available{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"}) == 1

panels.title: Update Available

panels.description: A timeseries panel showing the last time a device was seen.

targets.expr: time() - (max by(name, id, client_version) (tailscale_devices_last_seen_timestamp{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"}))

panels.title: Time Since Last Seen

panels.description: A pie chart showing the distribution of users by role in the selected tailnet.

targets.expr: count by(role) (tailscale_users_info{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"})

panels.title: Users by Role

panels.description: A pie chart showing the distribution of users by status in the selected tailnet.

targets.expr: count by(status) (tailscale_users_info{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"})

panels.title: Users by Status

panels.description: A pie chart showing the distribution of users by type in the selected tailnet.

targets.expr: count by(type) (tailscale_users_info{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"})

panels.title: Users by Type

panels.description: The total number of users that are currently logged in to the selected tailnet.

targets.expr: count(tailscale_users_currently_logged_in{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"} == 1)

panels.title: Users Logged In

panels.description: A table showing all users in the selected tailnet.

targets.expr: tailscale_users_info{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"}

panels.title: Users

panels.description: A table showing all keys in the selected tailnet.

targets.expr: tailscale_keys_info{job="$job", tailnet="$tailnet"}

panels.title: Keys

title: Tailscale / Overview
